return.description:
Returns the canonicalized absolute pathname on success. The resulting path 
   will have no symbolic link, '/./' or '/../' components.realpath returns FALSE on failure, e.g. if
   the file does not exist.The running script must have executable permissions on all directories in
    the hierarchy, otherwise realpath will return
    FALSE.

changelog.change:
Prior to this release realpath would not fail on
        *BSD systems if only the last last path
        component did not exist.
